title: -Wtentative-definition-compat warning in openldap.c with clang 21
body:
### I did this

Clang 21 [added](https://releases.llvm.org/21.1.0/tools/clang/docs/ReleaseNotes.html#id11) a `-Wtentative-definition-compat` warning that "diagnoses tentative definitions in C with multiple declarations as being incompatible with C++."

I see one of these warnings when compiling master:

```
openldap.c:1297:19: warning: duplicate declaration of 'ldapsb_tls' is invalid in C++ [-Wtentative-definition-compat]
 1297 | static Sockbuf_IO ldapsb_tls =
      |                   ^
openldap.c:499:19: note: previous declaration is here
  499 | static Sockbuf_IO ldapsb_tls;
      |                   ^
1 warning generated.
```

### I expected the following

I'm not sure if this C++ compatibility warning is worth fixing, but I would expect no warning when compiling.

### curl/libcurl version

5ef4451f7b90b1c4275d9d4a5a008848aaf9c8ac

```
curl 8.16.0-DEV (x86_64-pc-linux-gnu) libcurl/8.16.0-DEV OpenSSL/3.5.2 zlib/1.3.1 brotli/1.1.0 zstd/1.5.7 libidn2/2.3.7 libpsl/0.21.5 nghttp2/1.66.0 OpenLDAP/2.6.10
Release-Date: [unreleased]
Protocols: dict file ftp ftps gopher gophers http https imap imaps ipfs ipns ldap ldaps mqtt pop3 pop3s rtsp smb smbs smtp smtps telnet tftp ws wss
Features: alt-svc AsynchDNS brotli HSTS HTTP2 HTTPS-proxy IDN IPv6 Largefile libz NTLM PSL SSL threadsafe TLS-SRP UnixSockets zstd
```

### operating system

`Linux comp 6.16.4-arch1-1 #1 SMP PREEMPT_DYNAMIC Thu, 28 Aug 2025 19:49:53 +0000 x86_64 GNU/Linux`
